smack.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to hit someone, especially a child, with your open hand in order to punish them
smack.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: the debate about whether parents should smack their children
smack.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to hit something hard against something else so that it makes a short loud noise
smack.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He smacked the money down on the table and walked out.
smack.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to hit someone hard with your closed hand
smack.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a hit with your open hand, especially to punish a child
smack.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: You’re going to get a smack in a minute!
smack.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a hard hit with your closed hand
smack.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Talk like that and I’ll give you a smack in the mouth.
smack.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a short loud noise caused when something hits something else
smack.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The book landed with a smack.
smack.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: exactly or directly in the middle of something, in front of something etc
smack.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: There was a hole smack in the middle of the floor.
smack in the middle/in front of something etc
It’s smack dab in the middle of an earthquake zone.
smack.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: if something goes smack into something, it hits it with a lot of force
smack.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The car ran smack into the side of the bus.
